comments.commentBody:
tom:

I often take the cops' side, as well; and I understand the challenges facing thoughtful cops today who back away from policing violent neighborhoods. But we can't abide the shooting of unarmed men and call it "necessary", or the price we must pay for cops who are willing to police our ghettos.

Something has to give.

L’Osservatore:

I've known and liked MANY cops in my life. This one incident, even if it's proven that Mr. Scott indeed had a gun, which hasn't been proved yet, is but one in a long line of highly questionable killings of blacks by cops. And I'm not at ALL certain that the legitimate, automatic reaction to an armed man is to shoot him.

Mick:

We don't get violent protests over altercations that result in a civilian's death when he is indisputably armed and brandishing a weapon. We get them when it's plain that they weren't, or where there's doubt that he was.

It may be that the vast majority of protesters are peaceful, but this protest developed pretty much as all others have – violence, looting and general mayhem that precipitated a strong police response that in turn affected everyone protesting. It’s not reasonable to expect those responsible for enforcing the law and ensuring order to stand aside and allow a city to be damaged and lives and property endangered because some wish to protest injustice.

That said, we can expect this to replayed again and again across America, until we find a way for cops to enforce the law without shooting unarmed blacks. It’s that simple.

If you’re white and middle-class or more prosperous, American law enforcement works tolerably well at the local level. If you’re not white and you’re working-class or poor, it doesn’t, unless one accepts that the only way to maintain order in these communities is by controlling them through overbearing force. It’s clear that this is no longer tolerable by most of America, not just by our African American communities.

Changing mindsets and tactics, training, supervision and even replacing some cops with others, are not processes that are going to happen overnight; but until they do we can expect additional tragedies and peaceful protests marred by violence that authorities are forced to put down.

But cops must make a serious start.

How much money did Sarah Palin make from her reality TV show?   Millions? These two guys are real reality that actually did some good in this world.  Let them make a few bucks.  We have corporate crooks stealing millions with their banking scams and drug prices and have amassed vast fortunes doing it.  Many honor them as champions of capitalism.  They are just crooks in fancy clothes.   Cash in guys.  You deserve it.

Honestly, watching Ted Cruz sacrifice the smidgen of integrity he had to endorse Trump makes my skin crawl. I cannot imagine what his wife must be thinking. I'd be thinking divorce. Big settlement. Y U U G G G E. I hope his daughters see Hillary's new commercial and ask their dad what he could possibly be thinking.

Cruz was finished when he shut down the U.S Government in a filibuster reading from a childrens book by Dr. Suess.
If Trump wins, Cruz is still toast.

What is troubling and disappointing to me is that Secretary Clinton had opened up a potentially decisive lead in early August, and the Democrats have let that lead largely vanish. I don't want to point fingers and I don't knkow where the blame lies, but it is remarkable. We should have been at a point in this campaign when a desperate GOP would be fracturing around the shipwreck of a Trump candidacy, with ramifications up and down the ballot. Instead, they are closing ranks and maintaining a very strong position in congressional races. There's still time, maybe this will change, and maybe Secretary Clinton will rise and be able to exploit the willingness of GOP politicians to stand with Trump. I hope so, but I fear there will have been a huge missed opportunity to throw the GOP into well-deserved disarray.
More likely, be knows that he no longer has to oppose him to help make sure he loses.  Now he can watch Trump go down in flames and hold the high ground of supporting the nominee.  Win win.

He thinks Trump is gonna win.

Or else he wouldn't fold like a cheap suit.

Bleak.
Ah yes, Hillary Clinton, socialist.  Truly a deranged point of view.  She's a socialist only compared with Rafael Cruz.
If one can actually call that a "conscience"....

Oops, that is from 2012. This recent "Recalculating Climate Math" explains we're into negative carbon. McKibben does the math.

https://newrepublic.com/article/136987/recalculating-climate-math

"it would be easier for everyone if it weren’t that simple. ... relied on those jobs to build middle-class lives, and all of us burn the damned stuff, all day, every day. But the problem is, it is that simple. We have to “turn away.” We have to “keep it in the ground.” The numbers are the numbers. We literally cannot keep doing what we’re doing if we want to have a planet.

"“Keeping it in the ground” does not mean stopping all production of fossil fuels instantly. .... 17 years, as the wells we’ve already drilled slowly run dry, to replace all that oil with renewable energy. ... to replace gas guzzlers with electric cars. To retrain pipeline workers and coal miners to build solar panels and wind turbines. ... cities like Portland that have barred any new fossil fuel infrastructure ... Those are small steps, but they’re important ones.

"Even some big unions are starting to realize that switching to renewable energy would add a million new good-paying jobs by 2030. Everyone from nurses to transport workers is opposing the Dakota pipeline; other unions have come out against coal exports and fracking."

"It's not being graded on a curve."

Concerned Citizen -- Sometimes "more of the same" must be ended before a better idea can be pushed through. Inertia deeply anchored in stasis must be overcome.

The resulting movement is headed for a cliff? Time to start steering. The wheels are now on and the brakes are now off. Dismissing it as impossible will no longer serve.

I totally agree that in a rational word universal health care, or at least a public option, is a no brainer. My quibble is that you all think rallies and insistence and condemning realists gets the job done. Hillary and Obama have walked the walk and know the opposition. Bernie talks the talk, and it's great talk and great ideas and does some good. I have no patience with Jill Stein who is making things worse.

Burning down the house leaves you homeless. Anyone who thinks enabling Republicans by staying home (especially in midterms and when there's no "hero" around to excite and inspire you) is not part of the problem needs to think about kids who take their toys and go home. Though perhaps that's a bad metaphor, since they lose the toys too.

For those who missed it:

Note also that Republicans have eviscerated Obamacare by every means possible, by using the courts and state governments to chip away at its financial underpinnings. We are seeing the consequences now in the loss of big insurers.

This is not Obamacare's fault. It's all about Republicans. Please stop blaming Democrats for what they do.

Remember Judge Garland and all the other judges awaiting confirmation. WIth Republican judges a lot of public programs can be undermined, and their criminal behavior can be ignored.

Universal single-payer health care is the answer, and everyone who isn't wealthy or profiteering knows this. But it is politically impossible.

Hillary got branded a liar for trying in the 1990s. Meanwhile, self-dealing becomes ever more socially acceptable.

Republicans have done a good job of chipping away at the corners of Romneycare/Obamacare, making it dysfunctional by removing the moving parts that were needed make it work, after cutting deals to dilute it during the negotiations. No profiteer left unpaid ... But blaming Democrats for Republican obstruction is a loser's game.

We could make some progress towards Medicare for All if we elected Democrats across the board and offered our support. But we're too busy condemning those working in the real world and trying to find ways and means to realize we've invited in the real monsters.

It's easy to demagogue it; Bernie, a great guy, did a decent job of insisting without figuring out how to get it done, but Jill Stein is not helping at all, with her acceptance of fringe believes and willingness to exploit the situation.

I don't have the answer but I hope we will all support real public servants running for office: nowadays that would be Democrats. Throw the bums out and get working for each other again, not just the power brokers and big funders of infotainment and election funders.

Idealism is fine as long as you don't take your toys and go home when your unicorn doesn't win. Keep on tryin' please.

You heard it here first. If Trump wins, he will nominate his sister, Marian Trump Barry, a Federal Appellate Judge (as qualified as Alito), who happens to be pro-choice. That would serve all of those cowardly party over country Republicants right.
Cruz has given us the definitive illustration of his character, and it is bleak.
It's Cruz, what did you expect?
I think Cruz meant, "Searching FOR my conscience." Clearly, he didn't find it.
No problem. Whenever he looks at himself in the mirror -- he sees Paul Ryan looking back at him.

Of all the people who should not cross over to support Trump, it is Ted Cruz.  My conclusion is that he is more calculating and heartless than I thought possible.  Belittled by Trump, in the most personal of attacks against his family and his wife, he still finds himself able to pull the lever for this man who may be the most dangerous of all presidential candidates in memory.  What now do we think of Ted Cruz?  Here is my conclusion.  He is now thinking beyond this election.  If there is any way to co-opt Trump's supporters after this election relegates Trump to the trash heap of history, Cruz is now thinking he can be that person.  Sad that he would sink so low, but he is nothing but ambitious.  In four years, let us consider his change of mind on Trump as his epiphany.  Power at any cost, including his soul.

Are there any Republicans in office with a conscience. Please stand up. Oh yes Kasich. Collins? I can count them on one hand. To think this was the party of Lincoln. It became the party of Jefferson Davis, a southern slaver, segregationist, racist and traitor. That's the neo-Republican Donald Trump Ted Cruz party.
The only thing Ted Cruz shows is that he's an political opportunist, and a lapdog to a party that sees him as no more than a  forgetable footnote.

So apparently in Texas it is ok for another man to disparage and threaten your wife and degrade your father. You will still stand up and say that he's the man we want in the White House. What does that say about Texas voters? Cruz makes Texans look like fools. Don't they want something better?

"He went on to call Mr. Trump “a pathological liar”; “utterly amoral”; “a serial philanderer”; and “a narcissist at a level I don’t think this country has ever seen.”

Nevertheless he is the very best the Republican party has to offer the country.

Wow! What does that say about the Republican party today? And what does it say about the country?
The Kool-Aid has taken its desired effect.
The Cruz café is now offering a heaping helping of hypocrisy to already overfed cynics of American politics.
Either this comment is tongue in cheek or Trump wrote it

Cruz made a wise decision. We live in a time where rioting and looting get the open sympathy of a major party and its media allies. Cruz understands that Trump is the last defense of the rule of law and civilized behaviour.

A "religious man of principle" my left foot. Cruz is a fake and a fraud, a prosperity gospel hypocrite who aligns God's wishes with his own. Not a new game for "religious" politicians, and not all that well-played, but his believers are fools to begin with. A believer in God doesn't go around telling everyone how holy he is, he lives his faith in everything he does and proclaims God's goodness through his actions, not a bunch of deceiving words.
Just like Comrade Putin prefers to have it....
